publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3015 Janis Hughes: Stop AIDS Campaign-That the Parliament supports the Stop AIDS Campaign in its efforts to bring together a wide range of groups in the UK in order to raise awareness about the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and to campaign for increased UK and international action; notes that there are over 36 million people living with HIV/AIDS worldwide, of which 3,400 are in Scotland, and encourages people throughout Scotland to support the Stop AIDS Campaign when activists from Africa and the Caribbean visit Scotland to speak about their experiences on 7 and 8 May 2002.

S1M-3015 Stop AIDS Campaign (lodged on 22 April 2002) Marilyn Livingstone*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Michael Russell*, Michael Matheson*, Jackie Baillie*, Fiona McLeod*, Elaine Thomson*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Margaret Jamieson*, Bill Butler*, Johann Lamont*, John Scott*, Mr Murray Tosh*, Susan Deacon*, Mr John McAllion*, Scott Barrie*, Kate Maclean*, Cathie Craigie*

S1M-3015 Stop AIDS Campaign (lodged on 22 April 2002) Pauline McNeill*, Richard Lochhead*, David Mundell*, Trish Godman*, Helen Eadie*, Rhoda Grant*, Irene Oldfather*, Sarah Boyack*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-3015 Stop AIDS Campaign (lodged on 22 April 2002) Tommy Sheridan*, Tavish Scott*, Ms Margo MacDonald*, Mr Keith Harding*

S1M-3015 Janis Hughes: Stop AIDS Campaign-That the Parliament supports the Stop AIDS Campaign in its efforts to bring together a wide range of groups in the UK in order to raise awareness about the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and to campaign for increased UK and international action; notes that there are over 36 million people living with HIV/AIDS worldwide, of which 3,400 are in Scotland, and encourages people throughout Scotland to support the Stop AIDS Campaign when activists from Africa and the Caribbean visit Scotland to speak about their experiences on 7 and 8 May 2002. Supported by: Marilyn Livingstone, Mr John Home Robertson, Brian Fitzpatrick, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Michael Matheson, Jackie Baillie, Fiona McLeod, Elaine Thomson, Mr Michael McMahon, Mr Frank McAveety, Margaret Jamieson, Bill Butler, Johann Lamont, John Scott, Mr Murray Tosh, Susan Deacon, Mr John McAllion, Scott Barrie, Kate Maclean, Cathie Craigie, Pauline McNeill, Richard Lochhead, David Mundell, Trish Godman, Helen Eadie, Rhoda Grant, Irene Oldfather, Sarah Boyack, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Tommy Sheridan, Tavish Scott, Ms Margo MacDonald, Mr Keith Harding, Nora Radcliffe*, Mary Scanlon*, Ian Jenkins*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3015 Stop AIDS Campaign (lodged on 22 April 2002) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-3015 Stop AIDS Campaign (lodged on 22 April 2002) Mr Keith Raffan*, Christine Grahame*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-3015 Stop AIDS Campaign (lodged on 22 April 2002) Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-3015 Stop AIDS Campaign (lodged on 22 April 2002) Donald Gorrie*, Maureen Macmillan*
S1M-3015 Stop AIDS Campaign (lodged on 22 April 2002) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-3015 Stop AIDS Campaign (lodged on 22 April 2002) Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-3015 Stop AIDS Campaign (lodged on 22 April 2002) Cathy Peattie*
S1M-3015 Stop AIDS Campaign (lodged on 22 April 2002) Dr Sylvia Jackson*
